item.title: 路威酩轩集团蝉联欧洲五大股票之首
item.description: 奢侈品制造商路威酩轩集团（LVMH）在欧洲五大上市公司中失去了一席之地，遭遇了自2008年金融危机以来最严重的年度下滑。【原文：LVMH lost its place among Europe’s top five listed companies as the luxury-goods maker endures its worst year-to-date slide since the 2008 financial crisis.】

item.title: 香奈儿斥资 1.18 亿欧元在巴黎旗舰店附近建造大楼
item.description: 香奈儿有限公司去年在其巴黎主要精品店附近斥巨资购置了一处房产，因为奢侈品牌都在努力争取其店铺的黄金地段。【原文：Chanel Ltd. splurged on a property near its main boutique in Paris last year as luxury brands seek to secure prime locations for their stores.】

item.title: 英国央行行长丁格拉称英国服务业受脱欧冲击严重
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者斯瓦蒂-丁格拉（Swati Dhingra）表示，有新的证据表明，英国脱欧对英国服务贸易造成的打击比之前意识到的要大。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Swati Dhingra said there was new evidence that Brexit had dealt a bigger blow to Britain’s services trade than previously realized.】

item.title: 七国集团草案警告全球经济 "过度失衡
item.description: 七国集团的财政部长和央行行长们承诺解决全球经济 "过度失衡 "的问题，这一努力显然是针对中国的，尽管彭博新闻社看到的公报草案省略了中国的名字。【原文：Finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of Seven nations pledged to address “excessive imbalances” in the global economy, an effort clearly aimed at China, though a draft communique seen by Bloomberg News omitted the name of the country.】

item.title: 纽约私立学校宣布破产后恳求捐助者继续办学
item.description: 在纽约一名破产法官拒绝了一所上西区私立学校的紧急贷款请求后，这所学校正在努力筹集足够的现金，以维持到学年结束。【原文：An Upper West Side private school is trying to raise enough cash to stay afloat until the end of the school year after a New York bankruptcy judge rejected its request for an emergency loan.】

item.title: 加密货币 DeFi 项目 Cetus 协议遭遇安全漏洞
item.description: 据区块链安全公司PeckShield Inc.称，Sui区块链上的去中心化加密货币交易所和主要流动性提供商Cetus Protocol周四因安全漏洞损失了2亿多美元。【原文：Cetus Protocol, a decentralized crypto exchange and key liquidity provider on the Sui blockchain, lost more than $200 million in a security breach on Thursday, according to blockchain security firm PeckShield Inc.】

item.title: 英国将考虑全面修改 CPI 数据，以更好地衡量通胀走向
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，英国正准备考虑全面修改每月的消费者物价指数数据，以平滑季节性波动，这一举措将有助于英国央行和投资者更好地判断通胀压力的变化。【原文：The UK is poised to consider overhauling its monthly consumer price index figures to smooth out seasonal swings, according to people familiar with the matter, a step that would help the Bank of England and investors better gauge the shifts in inflation pressures.】

item.title: 美国初请失业金人数降至四周来最低水平
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请降至四周低点，进一步证明在贸易政策带来的不确定性不断增加的情况下，就业市场依然健康。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell to a four-week low, adding to evidence that the job market remains healthy in the face of growing uncertainty tied to trade policy.】

item.title: 德意志银行削减面临关税风险客户的风险敞口
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）在进行了一系列内部压力测试后，减少了对美国新关税敏感的公司的风险敞口。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG has reduced its exposure to companies that are sensitive to the new US tariffs, after the German lender conducted a series of internal stress tests.】

item.title: 枪支制造商柯尔特 CZ 计划进行更多收购，到 2030 年将销售额翻一番
item.description: Colt CZ 集团 SE 宣布计划在未来五年内将销售额和营业利润翻一番，主要通过收购来实现，因为这家捷克枪支制造商将从公共安全支出的增加中获益。【原文：Colt CZ Group SE announced plans to double both its sales and operating profit over the next five years, mostly through acquisitions, as the Czech gunmaker benefits from increased public spending on security.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔提出下半年降息路线
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，如果特朗普政府对美国贸易伙伴征收的关税稳定在10%左右，那么央行可能会在2025年下半年降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the central bank could cut interest rates in the second half of 2025 if the Trump administration’s tariffs on US trading partners settle around 10%.】

item.title: 墨西哥通胀加速超出预期，因为 Banxico 放宽了通胀限制
item.description: 墨西哥通胀率在 5 月的前两周加速超过预期，在经济出现停滞迹象的情况下，墨西哥央行积极降低利率。【原文：Mexico’s inflation accelerated more than expected in the first two weeks of May, with the central bank aggressively cutting interest rates amid signs the economy is stalling.】

item.title: 欧洲央行部分官员认为 4 月降息是 6 月行动的前奏
item.description: 根据会议记录，一些欧洲中央银行官员认为，4 月份借贷成本的下调是将此前预计在 6 月份进行的降息提前了。【原文：April’s reduction in borrowing costs was considered by some European Central Bank officials as bringing forward a cut that had earlier been expected to come in June, according to an account of the meeting.】

item.title: 特朗普削减预算，麻省理工学院将研究生名额削减 8
item.description: 美国麻省理工学院（Massachusetts Institute of Technology）招收的研究生人数正在减少，该校自诩的研究项目也在裁员，因为特朗普政府对大学的挤压使其财务前景变得扑朔迷离。【原文：The Massachusetts Institute of Technology is enrolling fewer graduate students in its vaunted research programs and laying off employees as the Trump administration’s squeeze on universities muddles its financial outlook.】

item.title: 人工智能正在帮助高管们解决休假后可怕的收件箱问题
item.description:
离开一段时间后，挖掘过程多年来首次得到真正的升级。【原文：

The process of digging out after time away is getting its first real upgrade in years.

】

item.title: 特朗普与蒂姆-库克的 "小问题 "是苹果的大问题
item.description: 苹果公司经常成为唐纳德-特朗普总统攻击的目标，在过去一个月里，随着其他大型科技公司的反弹，苹果公司的股价也受到了牵制。【原文：Apple Inc. has become a frequent target for attacks by President Donald Trump, a factor that has held the stock back as other big tech companies have rebounded over the past month.】

item.title: 财政政策担忧引发全球长期债券收益率飙升
item.description: 从美国到日本，全球最大经济体的长期借贷成本都在飙升，因为投资者质疑政府弥补巨额预算赤字的能力。【原文：From the US to Japan, long-term borrowing costs for the world’s biggest economies are surging as investors question the ability of governments to cover massive budget deficits.】

item.title: 马克龙高谈阔论与中国的关系并吹捧干邑白兰地调查的进展
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙在出访东南亚之前对中国总统习近平说，法国希望继续与北京建立 "强有力的经济关系"。【原文：France wants to keep building a “strong economic relationship” with Beijing, President Emmanuel Macron told Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping ahead of a trip to Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 埃尔多安发出信号：恢复推动信贷繁荣的贷款计划
item.description: 土耳其总统雷杰普-塔伊普-埃尔多安（Recep Tayyip Erdogan）表示有可能恢复一项国家支持的贷款担保计划，该计划曾引发企业贷款激增，从而使企业面临更宽松金融条件的前景更加光明。【原文：Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan signaled the potential revival of a state-backed loan guarantee program that previously triggered a surge in corporate lending, raising the prospect of looser financial conditions for businesses.】

item.title: 小米亿万富翁在技术展示会上推介中国新芯片
item.description: 小米公司的亿万富翁创始人周四概述了为其高端设备配备先进的国产移动处理器的计划，展示了该公司扩大其技术组合并与美国重量级企业竞争的雄心。【原文：Xiaomi Corp.’s billionaire founder outlined plans Thursday to outfit its top-end devices with advanced homegrown mobile processors, showcasing the company’s ambitions to expand its tech portfolio and compete with American heavyweights.】

item.title: 金属交易商开始看淡中国经济困境
item.description:
世界上最大的商品消费国所面临的问题众所周知。但接下来会发生什么呢？【原文：

The troubles of the world’s largest commodity consumer are well understood. But what comes next?

】

item.title: 罗马尼亚新领导人希望通过数周会谈达成预算解决方案
item.description: 罗马尼亚新当选的总统预计将就新政府问题进行数周的谈判，并表示重点需要放在解决预算危机和避免信用评级下调上。【原文：Romania’s newly-elected president expects several weeks of negotiations on a new government, saying the key focus needs to be on tackling the budget crisis and avoiding a credit rating downgrade.】

item.title: 赞比亚玉米收成创纪录预示通胀将降温
item.description: 赞比亚政府表示，赞比亚的玉米收成将从去年的 16 年最低点翻一番多，达到创纪录的高点，这将有助于平抑飙升的消费价格增长，并增加降息的可能性。【原文：Zambia’s corn harvest will more than double from a 16-year-low last year to a record high, the government said, which could help quell rampant consumer price growth and increase the chance of rate cuts.】

item.title: 马斯克的政治倒退让 X 公司开始寻找相关性
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）将探讨埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）退出政治舞台的意愿，以及这对他的社交网络 X 意味着什么。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner looks at Elon Musk’s stated desire to pull back from politics and what that may mean for his social network, X.】

item.title: 从财富管理到旅游业，海湾地区重新认识自己的作用
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天，我们将探讨海湾地区在世界上的角色如何发生转变。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at ways that the Gulf region’s role in the world is shifting. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 关税申报负担、审计审查拖垮美国进口商
item.description: 注意了，美国国税局审计员。美国海关和边境保护局的关税检查员们正逐渐成为你们最害怕的联邦监管人员，他们试图确保美国企业正确提交文件。【原文：Attention, IRS auditors. Tariff inspectors from US Customs and Border Protection are gaining on you in the race to be the most-feared federal regulators trying to ensure American businesses file paperwork correctly.】

item.title: 风险投资行业从未如此艰难
item.description:
新风险投资公司的资金急剧下降，给新公司带来了巨大压力。【原文：

Funding for new VC firms has turned sharply downward, putting enormous pressure on newcomers.

】

item.title: 道明银行贷款损失准备金低于预期，业绩超出预期
item.description: 多伦多多米尼克银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）尽管担心美国关税会阻碍经济增长，但为变质贷款预留的资金少于预期，因而超出了预期。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank beat estimates after setting aside less money than expected for souring loans, despite concerns that US tariffs will hamper economic growth.】

item.title: 南非将为 Transnet 提供 28 亿美元担保
item.description: 经财政部长同意，南非交通部同意向陷入困境的南非铁路和港口运营商 Transnet SOC 有限公司提供 510 亿兰特（约合 28 亿美元）的担保贷款。【原文：South Africa’s transport ministry with the concurrence of the minister of finance agreed to provide a 51 billion-rand ($2.8 billion) guarantee facility to Transnet SOC Ltd., the nation’s beleaguered rail and ports operator.】

item.title: 德国央行支持延迟欧洲贷款人交易规则
item.description: 德国联邦银行（Bundesbank）表示，欧洲应推迟针对银行交易业务的新的全球资本要求，并可能最终考虑对其进行永久性修改。【原文：Germany’s Bundesbank said Europe should delay new global capital requirements for banks’ trading businesses and could eventually consider permanent changes to them.】
